author: 小浪财讯
title: 交运ETF（561320）跌1.24%，半日成交额199.03万元|ETF_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，交运ETF（561320）跌1.24%，报0.959元，成交额199.03万元。交运ETF（561320）重仓股方面， 京沪高铁 截止午盘跌0.17%， 顺丰控股 跌1.75%， 中远海控 跌1.59%， 大秦铁路 涨0.00%， 上海机场 跌0.67%， 中国东航 涨0.25%， 南方航空 跌0.35%， 招商公路 跌0.74%， 中国国航 跌0.90%， 春秋航空 涨0.44%。
交运ETF（561320）业绩比较基准为 收益率，管理人为国泰基金管理有限公司，基金经理为吴中昊，成立（2022-11-30）以来回报为-2.98%，近一个月回报为1.79%。
风险提示：市场有风险，投资需谨慎。本文为AI大模型自动发布，任何在本文出现的信息（包括但不限于个股、评论、预测、图表、指标、理论、任何形式的表述等）均只作为参考，不构成个人投资建议。

author: @elnuevosiglo
title: Vereda Gamboa, 2.469 hectáreas de nueva área protegida en el Valle | El Nuevo Siglo
text:
[Miércoles, 12 de Marzo de 2025]
Fue oficializada la creación del Distrito Regional de Manejo Integrado (DRMI) de la Vereda Gamboa, un hito para la protección ambiental en el departamento del Valle.
Así lo determinó el Consejo Directivo de la Corporación Autónoma Regional del departamento (CVC). Esta nueva área protegida, ubicada en el Distrito Especial de Buenaventura, eleva el total de hectáreas de conservación en el Valle del Cauca a más de 680.000, consolidándolo como el departamento con más áreas protegidas en el país, alcanzando un 34% de su territorio bajo protección ambiental.
El DRMI Gamboa actuará como un puente ecológico entre las áreas protegidas del norte y sur del Pacífico Vallecaucano, actualmente fragmentadas por la urbanización y el desarrollo industrial. La presencia de carreteras y el crecimiento de la ciudad han generado una barrera para la fauna y la flora, pero la conservación de Gamboa permitirá restablecer el flujo natural entre las especies de ambos extremos del territorio.
Desde el punto de vista ecológico, esta área alberga dos de los seis ecosistemas del Pacífico Vallecaucano y una biodiversidad excepcional. Entre sus especies más representativas se encuentran el pavón del Pacífico, cuatro felinos incluyendo el puma y el jaguar, y cuatro primates amenazados como el mono aullador y el mono araña. Esta riqueza biológica hace de Gamboa una zona prioritaria para la conservación en la región.
Marco Antonio Suárez Gutiérrez, director general de la CVC afirmó “en el último Consejo dimos una gran noticia para el Valle del Cauca: hemos creado una nueva área protegida, un área que llevaba muchísimo tiempo esperando los vallecaucanos. Más de 2.469 hectáreas de la vereda Gamboa, donde está nuestro Consejo Comunitario de Gamboa, hoy ya es un área protegida. Esto se suma a las 678.000 hectáreas de áreas protegidas que ya teníamos en el Valle, lo que significa que superamos las 680.000 hectáreas”.
“La vereda Gamboa es esencial porque conecta con los ecosistemas del Pacífico Vallecaucano. Seguimos sumando áreas protegidas: ya tenemos 227, el mayor número en Colombia. Felicidad para todos los amigos del Consejo de Gamboa, que ya cuentan con su Distrito Regional de Manejo Integrado”, afirmó el directivo.
La declaratoria de área protegida del DRMI Gamboa beneficiará directamente a la comunidad, garantizando la conservación de sus recursos naturales y la continuidad de sus tradiciones. La zona provee a sus habitantes 59 productos maderables y no maderables del bosque, así como 115 especies de peces, crustáceos y moluscos. También es fuente de productos agroforestales esenciales para la economía local, como chontaduro, naidí, borojó, anón, yuca, pomaroso, limón, naranjo, papaya, piña y cacao.
Además, el área protegida incluye al menos 2.000 hectáreas de bosque tropical, con una capacidad estimada de captura de más de 100 toneladas de carbono por hectárea, lo que refuerza su papel en la mitigación del cambio climático y la regulación del ciclo del agua.
Entre otras virtudes, el DRMI tiene un alto valor cultural, ya que se encuentra dentro del territorio del Consejo Comunitario de la Comunidad Negra de Gamboa. Para esta comunidad, la conservación del ecosistema es fundamental para preservar su identidad y prácticas tradicionales. Muchas de sus expresiones culturales, como la música, dependen directamente de los recursos naturales, y su protección garantiza la continuidad de estos saberes ancestrales.
Esta declaratoria del DRMI Gamboa representa un avance significativo en la conservación ambiental del Valle del Cauca y de Colombia. Esta nueva área protegida refuerza los esfuerzos para mitigar el cambio climático, proteger la biodiversidad y garantizar el bienestar de las comunidades locales. Con esta decisión, la CVC continúa liderando iniciativas de protección ambiental que promueven la armonía entre el desarrollo y la sostenibilidad en la región.

author: John Pike
title: Zelenskiy Hails Sweden's NATO Entry, Eyes Day Ukraine Might Also Join
text:
Zelenskiy Hails Sweden's NATO Entry, Eyes Day Ukraine Might Also Join
By RFE/RL's Ukrainian Service March 07, 2024
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy hailed Sweden's entry into the NATO military alliance, largely viewed as a reaction to Russia's invasion of his country in 2022, saying the Scandinavian country was a "strong ally and a country that can be trusted."
Zelenskiy, who seeks eventual NATO membership for Ukraine, added that "there will be a day when Sweden will be able to congratulate Ukraine on joining the alliance as well. Together, we are always stronger."
Sweden joined NATO in Washington on March 7, two years after Russia's invasion of Ukraine forced it to rethink its national security policy and conclude that support for the alliance was the nation's best safety guarantee.
Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson handed over final documentation to the U.S. government, the last step in a long process to secure the backing of all members to join the alliance.
"Good things come to those who wait," U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said.
"Today is a truly historic day," Kristersson said. "Sweden is now a member of NATO. We will defend freedom together with the countries closest to us -- both in terms of geography, culture and values."
With reporting by Reuters
Source:

title: Polished Spa Nails Emacing Humanity in the Face of Adversity
text:
Polished Spa Nails Emacing Humanity in the Face of Adversity: различия между версиями [Перейти к навигации](#mw-head) [Перейти к поиску](#p-search) | | (Новая страница: «

A Million Dollars of Hope Upholding the Spirit of Philanthropy

In the wake of the devastating floods that ravaged several states in the United Stat…») (нет различий) Текущая версия на 23:35, 19 сентября 2024 A Million Dollars of Hope Upholding the Spirit of Philanthropy In the wake of the devastating floods that ravaged several states in the United States the Polished Spa Nails and has risen above and beyond to demonstrate its unwavering commitment to humanitarian aid With an unprecedented donation of one million and twelve thousand dollars the company has extended its compassionate reach to the communities most affected by this natural disaster Uniting for a Cause A Testament to Corporate Social Responsibility This remarkable gesture of philanthropy is a testament to Polished Spa Nails unwavering belief in corporate social responsibility As a leading provider of nail care services the company recognizes the importance of extending a helping hand to those who are suffering and in need of assistance This generous donation will play a vital role in providing immediate relief longterm support and hope for a ighter tomorrow Reaching Out with Compassion A Touch of Humanity in Trying Times The devastating impact of the floods has left innumerable families and individuals grappling with loss displacement and untold hardship In response to this urgent humanitarian crisis Polished Spa Nails has mobilized its considerable resources and dedicated team to offer tangible support to those who need it most A Nationwide Response Spreading Hope Across Affected States The companys unwavering commitment to making a difference extends across multiple states including Texas Louisiana Mississippi and Kentucky In each of these communities Polished Spa Nails will work closely with local organizations and emergency responders to ensure that the donated funds are used effectively and efficiently to provide immediate assistance and facilitate longterm recovery effort A United Effort Staff and Volunteers Committed to Healing Polished Spa Nails is not only contributing financial resources to this humanitarian effort but also mobilizing its dedicated staff and volunteers to lend a helping hand Dozens of employees have volunteered their time and expertise to support recovery operations providing essential services such as distributing supplies cleaning up deis and offering emotional support to those who have been affected Support That Extends Beyond the Donation A Holistic Approach to Recovery Polished Spa Nails recognizes that recovery from a natural disaster is a multifaceted process that requires more than just financial assistance The company is committed to providing holistic support that addresses both the physical and emotional needs of the affected communities This includes providing access to mental health services organizing community outreach programs and creating opportunities for rebuilding and renewal A Legacy of Giving A Company Culture Built on Compassion Polished Spa Nails has a longstanding tradition of philanthropic endeavors believing that giving back to society is an integral part of its corporate identity This latest donation is a continuation of the companys commitment to making a positive impact on the world The company plans to continue its support for flood relief efforts in the months and years to come working alongside community partners to ensure that affected areas fully recover and thrive A Call to Action Inspiring Others to Lend a Helping Hand Polished Spa Nails generous donation is not only a testament to its own commitment to philanthropy but also a call to action for others to do their part The company encourages individuals businesses and organizations to join in the effort to support those who have been affected by this devastating disaster Every contribution no matter how small can make a difference in the lives of those who need it most A Message of Hope A ighter Future Amidst Adversity While the floods have left a trail of destruction in their wake they have also ought out the best in humanity The outpouring of compassion and support from Polished Spa Nails and countless others is a beacon of hope in these trying times This generosity will not only help rebuild communities but also inspire countless others to believe in the power of human resilience and the transformative potential of giving

author: Gargi Sengupta
title: Amid 4-TD Game, Josh Allen Pays Ultimate Respect to Bills Mafia for Battling Adverse Weather Conditions to Cheer for Wild Card Match-Up - EssentiallySports
text:
Pittsburgh Steelers with a stunning 31-17 score, the Buffalo Bills are headed to the divisional round all thanks to Allen’s masterclass display of skills.
America’s Favorite Video Today
He constantly held the spotlight during the game, courtesy of his relentless efforts and scoring technique. He made a significant impact in the game with his impressive 52-yard touchdown run, capping off a remarkable four-touchdown performance that helped his team defeat Pittsburgh. However, the star quarterback came forth to thank somebody else who supported the Bills along with the Bills Mafia in helping them come out with flying colors in this cold, wild-card battle.
Allen is grateful to the team’s backbone! ADVERTISEMENT
Article continues below this ad
In the recent conference after the Bills and Steelers showdown, the quarterback came forward to discuss his feelings post-game. While speaking about his emotions, the star quarterback took a moment to extend his thanks to Bills Vice President, Operations and Guest Experience, Andy Major and Aaron Ramela along with fans, as he said, ” First of all, I would like to thank Andy Major and Aaron Ramela for the way that our stadium can play today for the fans that came out and shoveled through last night and this morning. I mean, that speaks volumes about our community and how much support that we have from our fans.”
USA Today via Reuters
Jan 7, 2024; Miami Gardens, Florida, USA; Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen (17) runs with the football against the Miami Dolphins during the second quarter at Hard Rock Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Sam Navarro-USA TODAY Sports
The primary worry for the game was the weather, with temperatures expected to plummet to 14 degrees after sunset. Additionally, according to Accuweather, the weather forecast for 4 p.m. indicated a temperature of around 18 degrees, accompanied by winds of approximately ten mph. The vice president took the initiative earlier to take care of the snow, as he said, “We have a plan of snow removal, of what we call bringing the seats .” He further added that there will be a solution that will aid in snow removal for smooth gameplay. And the vice president’s efforts showed up in the game as the Bills won the showdown.

The Gallery Blocks with Lightbox. Image Gallery, (HTML5 video , YouTube, Vimeo) Video Gallery and Lightbox for native gallery plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the gallery link text parameter in all versions up to, and including, 3.2.4.2 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Editor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

author: Millie Cooke
title: Suella Braverman claims Islamist extremists are now in charge of Britain
text: By Millie Cooke Published: 23/02/2024- 07:46 Don't Miss Most Read Trending on GB News Suella Braverman has claimed that Islamist extremists are now in charge of Britain, after Lindsay Hoyle admitted he was wrong when he decided to break with protocol as a result of security threats to MPs. The former Home Secretary said Britain is "sleeping walking into a ghettoised society", something she claimed threatens free expression. Hoyle sparked the fury of Tory and SNP MPs yesterday after he broke precedent by selecting a Labour amendment, along with a Government amendment, to an Opposition Day motion calling for a ceasefire in Gaza. Protocol dictates that the Commons Speaker would only select one of the amendments, and it is highly unusual for an opposition amendment to be selected. He apologised to the House of Commons last night following a walkout by SNP and Tory MPs. Hoyle said it was never his “intent” for the Gaza debate to have descended into such mayhem. Suella Braverman has claimed that Islamist extremists are now in charge of Britain PA The Speaker said: "Clearly today has not shown the House at it’s best. I’ll reflect on my part. I do not want it to have ended like this. I’ll meet with all the key players of each party." He added that he wanted to offer MPs "the widest range of propositions on which to express a view", partly as a result of growing security threats facing MPs. He said he didn't want to have to “pick up the phone to find a friend, of whatever side, has been murdered by terrorists”. Hoyle has been accused of bowing to pressure from Starmer to select the Labour amendment, an accusation both Labour and the Speaker have denied. If the Labour amendment hadn't been selected, his MPs would have had to choose between voting for a Government amendment - which stops short of demanding a ceasefire - or rebelling to vote for the SNP motion. But Starmer denied that he threatened the Speaker, telling reporters: “I can categorically tell you that I did not threaten the Speaker in any way whatsoever. “I simply urged to ensure that we have the broadest possible debate." Prime Minister Rishi Sunak criticised Hoyle’s handling of the Gaza ceasefire vote as “very concerning” but said the Commons Speaker is “reflecting on what happened”, as he warned parliamentarians should never be intimidated by “extremists”. Writing in the Telegraph, Braverman accused the Labour leader of “being in hock” to extremists and “taking the Speaker hostage” with a “grubby backroom deal”. LATEST DEVELOPMENTS: She said: "The truth is that the Islamists, the extremists and the anti-Semites are in charge now. "They have bullied the Labour Party, they have bullied our institutions, and now they have bullied our country into submission." She accused politicians of "burying their heads in the sand", claiming they prefer to believe in an "illusion" of a successful multicultural society. The former Home Secretary added: "But the law has not changed, mass extremism parades itself proudly, campuses remain dangerous places for Jews, and Labour is still rotten to the core." The former Home Secretary accused Sir Keir Starmer of 'being in hock' to extremists PA However, Sunak said parliamentarians "should not bend" to "extremists". He said: "What happened in the House of Commons last night is very concerning. “It seems that the usual processes and the way that the House of Commons works were changed. Now my understanding is that the Speaker has apologised for that and is going to reflect on what happened.” Sunak continued: “But I think the important point here is that we should never let extremists intimidate us into changing the way in which Parliament works. “Parliament is an important place for us to have these debates. And just because some people may want to stifle that with intimidation or aggressive behaviour, we should not bend to that and change how Parliament works. “That’s a very slippery slope.”

author: Scott Ghiringhelli
title: 7ATC demonstrates U.S. commitment then and now at international liberation ceremony
text: MAUTHAUSEN, Austria – The 7th Army Training Command’s Joint Multinational Readiness Center’s (JMRC) 1st Battalion, 4th Infantry Regiment (1st Bn., 4th Inf. Regt.) participated in the Mauthausen Concentration Camp Liberation and Commemoration Ceremony, May 5, 2024. “I want to thank the 7th Army Training Command Color Guard for joining us to pay homage to the liberators of the 3rd U.S. Army, whose brave men did not look away in the face of the atrocities that awaited them at Mauthausen the morning of May 5, 1945,” said the Honorable Victoria Reggie Kennedy, U.S. Ambassador to Austria. “The 7th ATC keeps that commitment alive in maintaining strong relationships with communities and partner nations in Europe. We are grateful for your service.” The Mauthausen main camp was active from Aug. 8, 1938, until it was liberated by the U.S. Army on May 5, 1945. The international liberation ceremony marked the 79th anniversary of the camp’s liberation. This year’s theme was "Law and Justice in National Socialism." “Striving for justice is the foundation of a democratic society…The dark chapter of National Socialism shows that law doesn’t always mean justice,” states this year’s thematic focus. “To this day, justice can be abused by authoritarian regimes to legitimize injustice. It is our responsibility to make sure that the law always serves a higher moral standard and that as a society, we actively stand up to injustices.” The 7th ATC and the multinational training that takes place at JMRC actively contributes to the security and stability of the region by assuring Allies and partners with a shared a security and defense environment and deterring threats through those partnerships. JMRC enhances multinational interoperability through challenging and realistic scenario-based training, replicating the real-world challenges experienced on the modern battlefield. The Europe-based combat training center provides joint and combined arms training conditions focused on developing Soldiers, leaders and units for success on current and future battlefields. JMRC is able to tailor exercises and operational environments based on the needs and requirements of the individual training audience. An essential part of training at JMRC is the opposing force, known as OPFOR, who provides a real-time, dynamic training environment where both the training audience and the OPFOR have free will to outmaneuver and defeat one another. As JMRC’s OPFOR, the 1st Bn., 4th Inf. Regt. conducts combat operations throughout the full spectrum of the contemporary operational environment. Soldiers from the 1st Bn., 4th Inf. Regt. made up the color guard and accompanying military procession during the Mauthausen Concentration Camp ceremony. For Spc. Kirk Jones, the day was a chance to further comprehend the atrocities that he had learned about in the past. “I came to Europe to explore all this and then I get to do this with the military. It’s really eye opening and humbling, and a very prestigious event to come to,” said Jones. Sgt. Rosevelt Mercado was taken with a sense of pride derived from representing the U.S. Army at what he described as a surreal experience. “I feel like I’m walking down some kind of lane in history,” said Mercado. “Being here in uniform just makes me feel very proud of the Army and being a part of this organization.” And for Sgt. 1st Class Joshua Takacs, the event hit closer to home. “I’ve been to Dachau, I’ve been to other concentration camps where my last name is prominent in these books that they have on record,” said Takacs. “It’s very momentous for me to be here, to not only represent my heritage, to represent the U.S. Army.” At the conclusion of the ceremony, Ambassador Kennedy personally thanked Soldiers from the 1st Bn., 4th Inf. Regt. for their participation at the event and explained the significance of the "Mauthausen flag," an American flag that was secretly stitched together by inmates of the Mauthausen Concentration Camp with the hope that they would soon be liberated by American forces. A representation of the flag was carried by service members in the wreath-laying precession. Kennedy went on to talk about the legacy of the Mauthausen Concentration Camp liberation as each year finds fewer survivors being a part of the remembrance. “We are the memory now, we have to make sure people remember,” Kennedy concluded. Liberation ceremonies at concentration camps throughout Europe strive to keep the memory of what happened alive in order to ensure these kinds of atrocities are not allowed to happen again. Through strong relationships developed when training together, 7th ATC enhances the U.S. relationships with Allies and partners that maintain the regional relationships developed over the last 70 years. “Our presence at this event symbolizes the U.S. commitment to democracy that was demonstrated in 1945 by defeating a common enemy and liberating those being persecuted,” said Brig. Gen. Steven P. Carpenter, commander, 7th ATC. “Today, as it did then, the U.S. Army in Europe assures our Allies and partners that we stand together against tyranny to deter our adversaries and help safeguard security in the region.” |Date Taken:||05.05.2024| |Date Posted:||05.06.2024 11:10| |Story ID:||470409| |Location:||MAUTHAUSEN, AT| |Web Views:||7| |Downloads:||0| This work, 7ATC demonstrates U.S. commitment then and now at international liberation ceremony, by [Scott Ghiringhelli](/portfolio/1760095/scott-ghiringhelli), identified by DVIDS , must comply with the restrictions shown on https://www.dvidshub.net/about/copyright.

organizations.name: 7th army training command’s joint multinational readiness center

author: NewsBreak Original
title: TCSO K-9 deputy finds missing man diagnosed with dementia
text:
4 hours ago TULSA COUNTY, Okla. — A Tulsa County Sheriff's K-9 deputy found a missing man diagnosed with dementia on Thursday morning.
TCSO K-9 deputy finds missing man with dementia (Tulsa County Sheriff's Office)
TCSO K-9 deputy finds missing man with dementia (Tulsa County Sheriff's Office)
The Tulsa County Sheriff's Office (TCSO) said deputies were called to a home in the Turley area around 2:30 a.m. on Thursday morning. A family had been searching for an 87-year-old man with dementia who had wandered away from his home for the past hour. TCSO said deputies immediately began searching the 50 acre property. Sgt. Mendenhall and Tracking K-9 Missy were brought in to join the search along with a drone with FLIR from the from Muscogee (Creek) Nation Lighthorse Police Department, TCSO said. TCSO said the drone spotted a figure along the fence line that Sgt. Mendenhall and Missy were tracking on around 4:30 a.m. Missy was able to find the missing man. TCSO said he was unharmed and reunited with his family. (Tulsa County Sheriff's Office)
(Tulsa County Sheriff's Office)
(Tulsa County Sheriff's Office)
